titles.title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to provide that a Federal employee who participates in the Government's health benefits program for a continuous period of 25 years or longer shall be eligible to continue enrollment as an annuitant, without regard to an interruption of less than 1 year during the 5-year period before seperation.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.
Referred to Subcommittee on Compensation and Employee Benefits.
Executive Comment Requested from OMB, OPM, GAO.

bill.summary: 4/21/1987--Introduced. Provides that a Federal employee who participates in the Federal health benefits program for a continuous period of 25 years shall be eligible to continue enrollment as an annuitant without regard to a break in service of less than one year during the five-year period before retirement.
